content.raw:
As discussed in the comments to Nate's reply at http://answers.gazebosim.org/question/925/multiple-materials-per-link/ Atlas' textures are not being loaded in Gazebo. This can be solved by adding material scripts just like for the other textured models but while trying to do so I ran into the problem of most parts (esp. the legs) requiring multiple textures and I only managed to load one (someone with more knowledge about Ogre material scripts can probably solve this faster).

The textures show up in rviz without any additional material scripts so while both Gazebo and RViz are based on Ogre, RViz' collada importer seems to be able to handle material properties embedded into the collada files better than Gazebo's does.
For example one of the collada trees from google warehouse loads up with textures and colors without any additional material scripts while the Atlas model is completely blank (even the color on the MultiSense head is missing and needs to be added through separate material tag/script in the sdf file).

It would make the process of creating new models a lot easier if Gazebo would be able to handle all the material properties embedded into the collada file without the need to write separate material scripts. According to Nate's comment this seems to be the desired behaviour anyway and Atlas seems to be supposed to show up as textured already so it's a bug and not a feature request.
